author: globo.com
title: Passa de 150 o número de mortos na pior tempestade da história da Espanha | Jornal Nacional | G1
text: Passa de 150 o número de mortes na maior tempestade da história da Espanha Subiu para 158 o número de mortos na tempestade que devastou cidades no leste da Espanha . A reportagem é do enviado especial Leonardo Monteiro. A enfermeira aposentada não conseguiu segurar as lágrimas: "Eu só quero que minha família saiba que estou bem. Ninguém esperava por isso, ninguém”. "É o tipo de coisa que a gente vê na TV, em filmes, mas nunca imagina que pode acontecer com a gente", resume um morador. Jorge Manuel contou que o primeiro alerta das autoridades só chegou dez minutos depois que a água começou a inundar as ruas e as casas. "Estamos acostumados com chuvas de outono, mas isso foi uma barbaridade”, diz. Pior tempestade da história da Espanha — Foto: Reprodução/TV Globo A tempestade de terça-feira (29) foi resultado de um fenômeno atmosférico típico do Mediterrâneo: a colisão de uma massa de ar frio com o ar quente que evapora do mar. Os meteorologistas acreditam que o aquecimento do Mediterrâneo, por causa das mudanças climáticas, agravou o fenômeno. Paiporta é uma cidade de pouco mais de 25 mil moradores. Ficou completamente devastada. Moradores tiveram as casas danificadas ou perderam algum parente ou conhecem alguém que foi atingido. Especialmente na região, esse foi um desastre sem precedentes. Pior tempestade da história da Espanha — Foto: Reprodução/TV Globo Para onde quer que se olhe, o que se vê é lixo, lama e uma infinidade de carros empilhados. Muitos parecem desafiar a lei da gravidade. Pior tempestade da história da Espanha — Foto: Reprodução/TV Globo Enquanto alguns tentavam desobstruir as ruas, outros caminhavam em busca de água e comida. Lázaro conta que já andou mais de 7 km porque o vilarejo dele está completamente destruído, sem luz, e por isso os supermercados estão fechados. Uma mulher tentava encontrar um parente. Dezenas de pessoas ainda estão desaparecidas. Mulher tenta encontrar parente desaparecido — Foto: Reprodução/TV Globo O primeiro-ministro espanhol visitou a região nesta quinta-feira (31) e prestou solidariedade às famílias das vítimas. Em meio à lama, José conseguiu enxergar uma pontinha de esperança: "É uma desolação total. Mas, com o tempo, tudo vai voltar ao normal. Assim como o rio”. Pior tempestade da história da Espanha — Foto: Reprodução/TV Globo LEIA TAMBÉM

author: none@none.com (Zulfiqar Ahmad)
title: PTI reschedules rally for Sept 8 after NOC cancellation, closure of roads
text: ISLAMABAD: The much trumpeted public rally on the call of jailed Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) founder Imran Khan was postponed on Thursday and rescheduled for September 8 following the city administration’s rescinding its no objection certificate (NOC) and closing the roads leading to the federal capital. A day ago, the party had announced to proceed with the rally at Tarnol despite revocation of the NOC by the ICT administration. However, the decision to postpone the rally was finalised after senior PTI leaders Omar Ayub Khan, Azam Swati, and Barrister Gohar met with Imran Khan at Rawalpindi’s Adiala Jail. Following the meeting, Azam Swati, Omar Ayub and Barrister Gohar confirmed the rally’s delay and announcing the new date. Swati declared, in the presence of Barrister Gohar, that the rally will now be held on September 8 with security arrangements in place. He added that PTI’s Islamabad chapter, led by Aamir Mughal, would secure the necessary permissions for the event. Goharsaid that the rally had been postponed and would now take place on September 8 in accordance with the founding party chairman Imran Khan’s directive. “After meeting with the PTI founder in Adiala jail, we’ve decided to postpone the rally,” he stated. He said that Imran Khan postponed the rally to avoid potential unrest in the country, describing the decision as “tough”. Gohar explained that the decision to delay the rally was made out of concern for maintaining peace, particularly in light of rising tensions in Islamabad. “Our party firmly believes in resolving issues through lawful means, and we cannot afford to let any situation spiral into chaos,” he stated. The PTI chairman noted that religious groups were reportedly gathering in Islamabad’s Red Zone, prompting fears of potential unrest. To ensure the safety and stability of the nation, the PTI leadership decided to postpone the rally, originally scheduled for Thursday. Despite the postponement, Barrister Gohar confirmed that other planned events would proceed, including rallies in Lahore on August 27 and in Islamabad on September 8. He urged supporters to understand that this decision was made to preserve peace, not as a sign of weakness. He also criticised the judiciary, particularly Chief Justice of Pakistan Qazi Faez Isa and Chief Justice Islamabad High Court (IHC) Aamer Farooq, for their decisions, which he argued have undermined the Constitution and legal system. He concluded by reaffirming PTI’s commitment to justice, law, and a peaceful resolution to the country’s challenges. He emphasised that the party’s struggle is rooted in legal and constitutional principles, and that maintaining peace remains a top priority. PTI Secretary General Omar Ayub also confirmed date for the rally was changed on the instruction of Imran. “We have received information that the government is conspiring to spread anarchy, under the cover of the jalsa,” he maintained. Earlier in the morning, PTI leader Sher Afzal Marwat was arrested by Islamabad Police and later released, according to police sources. Marwat was detained from a house situated at sector E-11 by a police team headed by station house officer (SHO) of Golra Police Station Fazle Khaliq. The police moved Marwat to the Golra police station. However, a spokesperson for Islamabad Police confirmed his release later in the day. A video showing Marwat and his associates clashing with police officers before his arrest has been widely circulated. The footage depicts resistance against the police, including pushing and verbal abuse directed at officers. Copyright Business Recorder, 2024 Comments Comments are closed.

author: world today news
title: New Casio G-Shock Rangeman GPR-H1000: A Strong and Feature-Packed Alternative to the Apple Watch Ultra
text:
Andrey Stavitsky January 6, 2024 00:02
346472
They cost half as much as the Apple Watch Ultra, but are much more brutal.
Casio Company
presented new watches from the G-Shock series. The Rangeman GPR-H1000 features vibrant colors and a bold design, plus plenty of features for outdoor enthusiasts.
A very secure and unusual device.
The Rangeman GPR-H1000 has a massive body with numerous “ribs”, steel inserts and buttons protected from accidental pressing. The canonical color of the device is yellow and black, but there is a boring modification only in black. The device is very strong, and you can also dive with it (water protection – 200 meters).
The gadget has a standard monochrome display, which displays a large amount of other
information in addition to the current time and date. Rangeman GPR-H1000 can record various types of training, count kilometers traveled, show the way back – there is a built-in GPS.
In addition, the watch received a heart rate sensor, pulse oximeter, sleep quality assessment function, barometer, thermometer, gyroscope, and digital compass. All data can be viewed directly on the monochrome screen or in a paired application.
The new product from Casio can be charged using a special charger or the battery can be recharged using a solar panel. Battery life is not disclosed. The cost of the Rangeman GPR-H1000 is 66 thousand yen or about 42 thousand rubles.
In December, we talked about the G-Shock MRG-B5000R-1 model. This is a limited edition watch with a titanium case and a price tag of several thousand dollars.
Everyone has forgotten about this Infinix, but in vain. It has a unique design and a powerful processor
3 mega discounts from Yandex.Market. Realme Buds Air 5, the legendary smart bracelet and compact power bank
